content:
Geospatial Addresses

  • Any cubic centimeter in, on, or around the planet can be directly addressed as a triple

  • Higher-order geospatial addresses

    • Sphere (, r)
    • 3D polygon

      • Closed polygon , , Ö,

        • , , Ö, is a general 2D polygon
        • z0 = z1 = Ö = zn-1
      • Height h
    • Set {g0, g1, Ö, gk-1}

      • Each gi is itself a geospatial address
      • Union of the volumes represented by g0, g1, Ö, gk-1
      • giís not necessarily contiguous
